author: Susan M. Schultz
text: --Mom is wearing a Kailua Surfriders Staff teeshirt this morning. That must be Bryant’s old shirt. No, she insists, it’s an Iowa teeshirt. The young man down the street, the one she’s never met, gave her an Iowa teeshirt when he heard she’d gone to Iowa. It’s Iowa.
She was sweet at 4 a.m., Bryant says. They had the first conversation about the shirt then.
--Israel sends more ground troops into Lebanon.
, we read in the Washington Post.

--Compare and contrast the acquisition of a language to its loss. Avoid the trap of merely saying that the latter happens in reverse order of the former. You are likely to do better if you see them as similar processes, though one leads to gain, the other loss. Think chemistry. Think performance of a script. Think
--Think two old men fishing for a beautiful young woman in a lake. Think one of them might get “lucky.”
--When are you leaving? Where are you going? Are you taking the kids?
--Sangha and May hatch plots of their own. Go quiet when I arrive. In this life, you either make plots or have them hatched around you. Like eggs. Like poisoned ones.
